header.title: snmpa_error_logger

erlref.modulesummary: Functions for Reporting SNMP Errors through the error_logger

description.p: The module snmpa_error_logger implements the snmpa_error_report behaviour (see snmpa_error_report) containing two callback functions which are called in order to report SNMP errors.
This module provides a simple mechanism for reporting SNMP errors. Errors are sent to the error_logger after a size check. Messages are truncated after 1024 chars. It is provided as an example.
This module is the default error report module, but can be explicitly configured, see snmpa_error and configuration parameters.

func.name: config_err(Format, Args) -> void()
func.fsummary: Called if a configuration error occurs

desc.p: The function is called if an error occurs during the configuration phase, for example if a syntax error is found in a configuration file.
Format and Args are as in io:format(Format, Args).

func.name: user_err(Format, Args) -> void()
func.fsummary: Called if a user related error occurs

desc.p: The function is called if a user related error occurs at run-time, for example if a user defined instrumentation function returns erroneous.
Format and Args are as in io:format(Format, Args).
